title: What are the best video conferencing websites? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, allow me to say that I may be bias as a Senior Account Manager at IVCi. That said, this role allows me to experience all types of video conferencing software and fully vet the experience for my customers. I am in agreement with one of the responders above the Zoom is a great solution and has taken the market by storm; their features are possibly unmatched and ease of use makes many customers happy. I believe that one challenge with Zoom is that it does not make proper consideration for the endpoints you have existing in an environment outside of the H323/SIP Room connector. Allowing these endpoints to dial into a Zoom Room is only step 1; what about assuring their quality and not making existing investments obsolete before their time? The truth is, the industry is changing fast, which means a lot of companies don’t just need the “now” solution in cloud video conferencing, they need the solution that bridges the gap between their previous strategy and their new strategy. That is why I believe a company called Videxio is still on the forefront of Video Conferencing software and cloud solutions. Videxio was has been around a number of years, founded and run by some of the brightest minds from the original TANDBERG team. The solution offers both a powerful, simple video software and all-inclusive video meeting rooms, in addition to the ability to register endpoints (both legacy and new) to their quality assured MPLS. On top of that, as many commpanies make use of their Skype for Business access, Videxio is now offering the ability for endpoints to dial directly into S4B users/meetings and vice versa, which is extremely powerful. Why haven’t you heard of them? Simple, their marketing to date has been minimal because they are often white-labeled by the companies, like IVCi, who sell their service. That’s changing this year and you shoudl start to hear a lot more. So, if you are really just looking for a software, then Zoom has everything you could need, but if you are looking for a company cloud strategy, I might suggest leaning towards Videxio.

The following list is by no means complete, but it can give you some idea about the best video conferencing solutions available: TrueConf Server: an on-premise solution allowing users to make video calls and hold group conferences with up to 250 participants. It also provides different collaboration tools such as screen sharing, instant messaging, and conference recording. Website: https://trueconf.com/products/server/video-conferencing-server.html 2. Skype for Business: an application that supports audio/video calls and offers some collaboration tools like desktop sharing and chat.  Website: Skype | Communication tool for free calls and chat 3. Highfive: a cloud and web-based service for collaboration and video conferences with up to 50 participants.  Website: Video Conferencing | Highfive 4. Zoom: a cloud service used by businesses for holding online video meetings and collaboration.  Website: Video Conferencing, Web Conferencing, Webinars, Screen Sharing 5. BlueJeans: a cloud-based service that supports video calls, screen sharing, and groups conferences.  Website Blue Jeans Network 6. U Meeting: a browser-based tool for video calls and conferences.  Website: Video Meeting, Webinars, Screen Sharing, Group Chat App | 7. GoToMeeting: a web-hosted video conferencing solution.  Website: Online Meeting Software with HD Video Conferencing | GoToMeetin 8. TeamViewer: a cloud solution used for desktop sharing, remote control, web conferencing, and file transfer.  Website: https://www.teamviewer.com/r 9. Slack: a messenger with some video conferencing capabilities.  Website: Where work happens 10. Adobe Connect: a web-based solution supporting on-demand-broadcasting and webinar streaming.  Website: Adobe web conferencing software
